newsitem.title: GREECE: PAPOUTSANIS SEES 97 PRETAX OF 50-100MLN DRS.
newsitem.headline: PAPOUTSANIS SEES 97 PRETAX OF 50-100MLN DRS.

text.p: Papoutsanis , a producer of soap and olive oil producer and an importer of soft drinks, sees pretax earnings reaching around 50-100 million drachmas in fiscal 1997, its management said.

Shareholders were told at Monday's annual meeting that the company expected sales growth of around 20 percnt in soap and soft drinks this year but saw sales in olive oil down around 15-20 percent due to lower market prices.
Papoutsanis posted pretax profit of 36 million drachmas in fiscal 1996, improving on a 1.318 billion drachma loss in the previous year.
Turnover grew 7.0 percent to 5.687 billion with Papoutsanis raising its ex-factory prices around 3-4 percent.

On a consolidated basis, Papoutsanis narrowed its loss to 356 million in 1996 from around 1.7 billion drachmas in 1995 on marginal turnover growth to 6.081 billion drachmas. --Angelos Kiosklis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
